name: Inner Peace
description:
Here's a fun challenge - breathe in and out with the monk while playing so you, too, can achieve inner peace and the end of all your suffering (probably).

FEATURES:

Battle evil spirits as you try to meditate your way to enlightenment, channeling your inner energy into meteorological events and violence! Face off against hordes of chōchin-obake (lantern spirits) and kechibi (ghostly fireballs) to find your inner zen, and watch as their parts litter the ground while you meditate undisturbed. But be warned; should your focused thinking be disrupted, you may never find true tranquility.

MY THOUGHTS:

It was pretty fun making this game, even if I didn't get as much done as I'd have liked. I was going for that calming 5-minute game experience, but may have made it a bit too easy and repetitive. If I had more time I'd add a better scoring system, more enemies, more fun in general, but I'm pleased with what I achieved in the time I had - particularly with the art. It's been good for me as well, since I haven't really made any games in the last few months, so this was a great excuse to get back into doing that! And hopefully you have as much fun playing it as I had making it!

Oh, and why not post your high scores too? I'd love to see how well everyone did, and if anyone beat my high score - I'll tell you if you did! Good luck!
